isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - WATER PUMP AND THERMOSTAT - WATER PUMP - COMPONENT CHANGES

note.para: Effective with S/N 532981 all engines use a new four groove water pump/fan pulley replacing the six groove pulley used previously. The reduction in the number of pulley grooves is made possible by the use of the gear drive power steering. Refer to Figure 10.3. Model year pulleys should not be intermixed as belt groove center distances as well as pulley diameters are different.

Effective with S/N 575608 a three- piece spun sheet metal fan pulley arrangement (rather than one-piece cast iron) is used for production and service on all engines equipped with a four groove, 1:1 fan ratio fan pulley. The 1:1 fan ratio equipped engines can be identified by measuring the diameter 227 mm (8.918 in.) of the fan pulley. Three or six groove fan pulleys as well as 1.2:1 fan ratio four groove pulleys (with 190 mm (7.460 in.) diameter) are not changed. Do not intermix pulleys on any engine, as belt groove center distances as well as pulley diameters are different. Refer to Figure 10.4.

step1.para: Verify end play by grasping the water pump pulley hub and moving the pulley back and forth.
If end play appears to be excessive, completely loosen all bolts and measure end play using a dial indicator.
If maximum end play exceeds the dimension listed in "SPECIFICATIONS", repair or replace the assembly, as required. Refer to "SPECIFICATIONS" for dimension.
